metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20166 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In various methods of kernel base drivers, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a heap buffer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-182388481References: Upstream kernel

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20166` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1069-aws - 5.4.0-1069.73~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1073-azure - 5.4.0-1073.76~18.04.1
No subscription required
